thread.title: Drug peddler re-arrested

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Drug peddler re-arrested
text:
Tribune News Service
Panchkula, October 18
The district police today arrested a drug peddler, Om Prakash, who had fled from its custody last month. The police said he was hiding in Kharar. He will be produced in court tomorrow. Om Prakash had fled from police custody on September 2 with help of his accomplices. The local police had arrested Om Prakash and allegedly recovered Rs 1.58 lakh along with drugs worth Rs 1 lakh from him. He told the police that he used to supply drugs in Chandigarh and Mohali. On September 2, a police team headed by Sub-Inspector Naib Singh had taken Om Parkash to Chandigarh for the identification of a drug supplier. While returning, the police vehicle was intercepted by a Honda City car near the state Vigilance police station in Sector 17. The car occupants involved the police party in heated arguments. Following this, they pushed the policemen and fled from the spot. It was then that the police realised that Om Prakash had also fled from the police vehicle. Later, the police had recovered the Honda City car used in the incident and had arrested Jitender, a resident of Sector 21 in Chandigarh.
